alxartes wrote:
> I am quite new with Heritrix and just started crawling websites.I would 
> be very grateful if someone can provide some answers to the following 
> inquiries.
> 
> 1. Does Heritrix produce a DAT file aside from the ARC file? Is there 
> an open source tool that can extract the dat file from the arc file? We 
> need the meta data like-contents of the DAT file.

We don't have DAT-writing capabilities as part of the Heritrix package.
There's a '--store' option mentioned in the Bnf ARC Tools
(http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?BnfArcTools) that I believe
can create DATs; I've inquired with the author for more details.

> 2. How does Heritrix verify that the files that it downloaded are not 
> corrupted? Does it use md5 checksum?

The only guard against corruption during HTTP download is that provided
by the protocols: TCP/IP checksums (and, when using HTTPS, its integrity
checks).

A SHA1 checksum of the HTTP response originally received is taken on the
fly and stored in the crawl.log for later reference.

Other collection-management systems (completely separate from the crawler)
monitor the archived disk files (mainly ARCs) for decay or other corruption.

- Gordon @ IA
